Defines how assets are managed when there is more than one root node displayed (either selected above, or through a replacement root node setting). If there is only one root node selected, then this option has no effect.

boolean.true_text: Assets must be a child of ALL selected root nodes
boolean.false_text: Assets must be a child of at least ONE root node

field.note: If set to 'Yes', only directly linked assets of the root node will be printed (direct parents or children). Otherwise, all assets above or below the root node will be printed.
Select 'Up the tree' to list assets above the root nodes, or 'Down the tree' to list assets below.

This optional setting only applies when Direct Links Only is turned off. If a number is entered here, assets must be at least this number of levels below/above a root node to qualify for listing. Immediate children/parents are considered to be at level '1'. Setting this attribute to 0, will include the root nodes in the results

This optional setting only applies when Direct Links Only is turned off. If a number is entered here, assets must be no more than this number of levels below/above a root node to qualify for listing. Immediate children/parents are considered to be at level '1'. Setting this attribute to 0 (with the minimum depth/height set to 0 as well) will only return the root nodes.

This setting only applies when Direct Links Only is turned on. Assets will only be listed if their link to a root node is of one of the link types selected here. The default is to show links visible in the asset map, that is TYPE_1 and TYPE_2 links.
The value provided in that field will be used to filter the assets returned. You will need to enable 'Link Value Filtering'.
This specifies if assets returned should have link value equal or different from the 'Link Value' field. You will need to enable 'Link Value Filtering'.

If set to 'Yes' and lookup direction is set to 'down the tree', only assets with the link value equal to the 'Link Value' field will be returned. If set to 'Yes' and the lookup direction is set as 'up the tree', only parents of children assets with the link value equal to the 'Link Value' field will be returned.

A standard list displays all assets on a single page or can be broken up into multiple pages.
An A-Z listing displays search terms grouped by their first letter.
Custom Grouping allows a list based on user specifed grouping conditions.

Set to '0' (zero) to list all assets on the same page.
NOTE: This option is only valid when using the standard or custom grouping list formats..
If the listing type is Random, this defines how many assets are randomly displayed ('0' displays a single asset).
Keywords can be used to dynamically set the number of items on the page.

Position in the list to start at. For custom grouping, this will apply to the individual group listing.
Keywords can be used to dynamically set the start position.

A Single Page will display all assets on one page, with headings for each letter in the list. When a user clicks a letter in the list of characters, it will automatically jump to that letter on the page.

This option only applies for a Single Page A-Z Listing.
Available keyword is %letter_group% which generates an anchored heading for each letter.
This is the text that will be printed to link to the previous results page
This is the text that will be printed to link to the next results page
Link text to a page containg assets in the A-Z list format which do not begin with A-Z, i.e. numbers or other characters

This format defines the individual layout of items on the listing's linked page list. If you are using the A-Z list format, this will define the individual layout of items on the linked character list. Available keywords: %page_link% and %page_number%.

This format defines the layout of the current page number on the listing's linked page list. If you are using the A-Z list format, this will define the layout of an item in the linked character list when no results are found under that particular letter. Available keywords: %page_number%.

This option lets you define if the navigational text, like 'Previous Page' or 'Next Page', should be hidden if these text is not a link. This is useful to hide 'Next Page' on last page and 'Prev Page' on first page etc.,.
You can configure the list to include certain assets at specific positions, even if they would not normally be included in the list.

If this is set to Yes, an additional "Page Contents (No Results)" bodycopy will appear, allowing you to specify different contents when there are no assets to list. Note that this is turned on by default.
